content: i a w s n hirl carf i designed this pattern to use up a whole ball of scheejpes whirl the result is a good size snuggly scarf any yarn could be used but you may need to adjust your hook size to suit the pattern is an easy 2 row repeat - 1 row of 2 x treble clusters then 1 row of 3 x treble clusters alternating starting and ending with the 2 treble cluster row - 24 clusters wide finished size - 28cms wide - 180cms long unblocked the pattern is written using uk crochet terms treble_crochet = treble_crochet the pattern has only been tested by me so please forgive any rookie errors  materials  1 x ball scheejpes whirl 4ply 200g 1000 metres  3 5mm crochet hook i found this size hook suited my gauge best and gave a nice drape to the scarf you may wish to try a different size hook depending on your own gauge start - make a foundation chain i used a chain of 76 stitches this should give you a scarf that is 24 clusters wide you could make the scarf wider or narrower you can undo excess chain from the cast on slip_stitch if you find there are too many when you work your way back along the chain set up row - 2 treble_crochet into the 4th chain from hook skip 2 chain *2tr into next chain skip 2 chain* repeat ** until the last 3 chain skip 2 chain 1 treble_crochet into last chain turn row 2 - chain 3 3tr in between the 2tr from the previous row *skip the gap between each v and make 3tr between the 2tr of the previous row* repeat ** until the last 3tr have been worked into the last v then 1tr into the 3rd stitch of the turning chain turn row 3 - chain 3 2tr into the top of the 2nd treble_crochet of the 3 treble cluster see the attached close up photo *skip the gap between the 3 treble_crochet clusters 2tr into the top of the 2nd treble_crochet of the 3 treble cluster* repeat ** until the end of the row then 1 treble_crochet into the top of the turning chain of the previous row continue with row 2&3 until the scarf is the required size or the yarn is used up weave in the in ends © jane hunter at hedgerow yarns 2018 all rights reserved for personal use only i a w s n hirl carf © jane hunter at hedgerow yarns 2018 all rights reserved for personal use only
